args.value: Permit(address owner,address spender,uint256 value,uint256 nonce,uint256 deadline)

doc_string.value: @dev Increases supply by factor of (1 + frac/1e18) and mints it for _to
@notice Get the version of this token contract

natspec.author: Curve.Fi
natspec.details: Follows the ERC-20 token standard as defined at https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-20

approve(address,uint256).details: Beware that changing an allowance via this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. This may be mitigated with the use of {increaseAllowance} and {decreaseAllowance}. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
approve(address,uint256).notice: Approve the passed address to transfer the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender

params._spender: The address which will transfer the funds
params._value: The amount of tokens that may be transferred

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Burn an amount of the token from a given account.

params._to: The account whose tokens will be burned.
params._value: The amount that will be burned.

decimals().details: Implemented as a view method to reduce gas costs
decimals().notice: Get the number of decimals for this token

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: This is alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for the potential race condition
decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Decrease the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller

params._spender: The address which will transfer the funds
params._subtracted_value: The amount of to decrease the allowance

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: This is alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for the potential race condition
increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Increase the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller

params._added_value: The amount of to increase the allowance
params._spender: The address which will transfer the funds

mint(address,uint256).details: Mint an amount of the token and assigns it to an account. This encapsulates the modification of balances such that the proper events are emitted.

params._to: The account that will receive the created tokens.
params._value: The amount that will be created.

mint_relative(address,uint256).details: Increases supply by factor of (1 + frac/1e18) and mints it for _to

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Supports smart contract wallets which implement ERC1271 https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1271
permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Approves spender by owner's signature to expend owner's tokens. See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612.

params._deadline: The timestamp after which the Permit is no longer valid.
params._owner: The address which is a source of funds and has signed the Permit.
params._r: The bytes[0:32] of the valid secp256k1 signature of permit by owner
params._s: The bytes[32:64] of the valid secp256k1 signature of permit by owner
params._spender: The address which is allowed to spend the funds.
params._v: The bytes[64] of the valid secp256k1 signature of permit by owner
params._value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfer token for a specified address

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens from one address to another.

params._from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params._to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

version().notice: Get the version of this token contract

natspec.notice: Base implementation for an LP token provided for supplying liquidity
natspec.title: Curve LP Token V5
